pure.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a pure substance or material is not mixed with anything
pure.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: My mother’s life was pure hell.
The chairman dismissed the report as pure speculation.
By pure chance, I met Sir Malcolm that morning.
pure.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: clean and not containing anything harmful
pure.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We had trouble finding a pure water supply.
Up here the air was purer.
pure.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: without any sexual experience or evil thoughts
pure.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: They’re too pure and innocent to know what’s really going on.
pure.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: a cloudless sky of the purest blue
Her voice, clear and pure, soared up to the roof.
pure.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: His music is pure New York.
pure.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: bred from only one group or race
pure.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: My husband is pure Japanese and traces his family back 800 years.
The Highland is the oldest and purest breed of cattle in Britain.
pure.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: done according to an accepted standard or pattern
pure.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Gothic architecture in its purest form
pure.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: complete and total
pure.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He had discovered the truth by pure chance.
It was pure coincidence that I arrived on the same plane.
Lucinda flashed him a smile of pure joy.
